cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi east of the mouth of the Mississippi River and 105 mi SSE of Biloxi, Mississippi
cyclone.trajectory: very slow north-northwest drift today, a turn north this afternoon, then a slow northeast track inland across Alabama–Georgia and toward the South Carolina coast late Thursday into Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Mississippi/Alabama border (around Biloxi–Mobile area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-Storm Watches confined to the north-central Gulf Coast from east of the Pearl River to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Storm-Surge Warnings from the mouth of the Mississippi River eastward to Navarre, Florida (Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact zone along the northern Gulf Coast; inland impacts spreading across AL, GA, and into SC/NC late week
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤7%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Friday; occasional gusts possible
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Charleston based on current guidance
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 4–6 inches with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado threat and brief marine squalls as the weakening center passes nearby
